conclusion: Need to find out how much heat is transferred during the process from A to C.
The x-axis is volume (V) in units of 10^-3 m^3, and the y-axis is pressure (p) in units of 10^5 Pa. Points A, B, and C are identified.
Point A is at V = 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and p = 3 x 10^5 Pa.
Point B is at V = 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and p = 2 x 10^5 Pa.
Point C is at V = 3 x 10^-3 m^3 and p = 2 x 10^5 Pa.
The path is A to B to C.
Using the ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Changes in internal energy depend only on changes in temperature: ΔU = nCvΔT.
Heat transferred is given by Q = ΔU + W.
To find total heat transferred from A to C, consider processes from A to B and B to C separately.
Temperature at state A is 27°C, which is 300 K.
Find temperatures at states B and C.
From A to B: Volume is constant, pressure decreases, isochoric process, p ∝ T.
From B to C: Pressure is constant, volume increases, isobaric process, V ∝ T.
TC is back to 300 K, same as TA.
From A to B: Isochoric process, no work is done, W_A_to_B = 0.
From B to C: Isobaric process, work done is W_B_to_C = 200 J.
Total work done from A to C is 200 J.
Q_total = Q_A_to_B + Q_B_to_C.
